data.title: Interatlantic
data.text:
Privacy Police CONDITIONS OF ACCESS

The user must access our web site in accordance with good faith, the rules of public order, these general conditions of use and, if appropriate, the specific conditions of use that may be applicable. Access to our web site is carried out under the user’s own exclusive responsibility, and they shall be responsible in any case for the damages that they may cause to third parties or to us. The user is expressly forbidden from using and obtaining the services and contents offered on this web site, by procedures other than those stipulated in these conditions of use, and if appropriate in the specific conditions that govern the acquisition of certain services.Taking into account the impossibility to control the information, contents, opinions and services contained on other web sites that may be accessed through the links (links, banners, buttons, search engines) that our web site makes available to you, we hereby inform you that Interatlantic Fish S.L.U.. is exempted from any responsibility for any kind of damages that could arise from the use of these web sites external to our company by the user, and we recommend that the user should read the legal notices which govern all web sites. The existence of hyperlinks on external web sites which allow access to our portal does not under any circumstances imply the existence of commercial or trading relations with the owner of the web site where the hyperlink is established, or the acceptance by Interatlantic Fish S.L.U. of its contents or services.

CONFIDENTIALITY OF PERSONAL DATA

CONSENT AND AUTHORIZATION TO PROCESS PERSONAL DATA

Interatlantic Fish S.L.U., as the entity responsible for its files, considers that when you accept to send your personal details through the different forms that this web site contains, or by e-mail, you are expressly giving us your authorization and consent to process and incorporate your details into our databases, although of a revocable nature and without retroactive effects, and you accept the processing conditions expressed below.

WHAT DATA DO WE REQUEST AND FOR WHAT PURPOSE?

The data we request is appropriate, relevant and strictly necessary for the purpose for which it is collected, and under no circumstances are you obliged to provide it to us. However, enquires contained on the forms must compulsorily be answered in order to comply with your request. Likewise, you authorize us to verify the data provided in the Contact form, and you certify that all the details that you provide are correct, truthful and relevant for the purpose for which we request them. Our web site gathers your personal details on receiving forms and by e-mail. Under the link Contact we request your personal details to answer your queries, comments or requests for information. Your details will be incorporated into a general file, which implies your consent to receive our commercial information or newsletters. Likewise, we make available various e-mail addresses, so that you can request any kind of information, clarification or explanation. If personal details are included in the e-mail, or your address contains personal details, you authorize us to incorporate them into our corresponding files. These files shall be governed by these privacy policies. Interatlantic Fish S.L.U. reserves the right to decide on whether or not to incorporate your personal details into its files.

ASSIGNMENT OR COMMUNICATION OF YOUR DATA

Interatlantic Fish S.L.U. informs you that your details are treated with confidentiality, and are used exclusively internally and for the purposes indicated. Therefore, we do not assign or communicate your details to any third party, except in the cases legally foreseen, or when the user authorizes us to do so.

UPDATING AND CANCELLATION OF YOUR PERSONAL DATA

So that we can maintain your personal details updated, it is important for you always to inform us whenever they change; otherwise, we shall not be responsible for their correctness.We consider that if you do not expressly cancel your personal details from our databases, you continue to be interested in belonging to them, until Interatlantic Fish S.L.U., considers it appropriate and for the time that they are relevant for the purpose for which they were obtained.

Cookies may be used to aid your browsing of our web site and, consequently, in the event of use, the user accepts their use and the tracking of IPs. The web site’s traffic analyzer uses cookies and the tracking of IPs which allow data to be gathered for statistical purposes: date of first visit, number of times visited, date of last visit, URL and domain of origin, browser used and screen resolution. However, if they so wish, the user may disable and/or remove these cookies following the instruction on their Internet browser. Under no circumstances do the cookies provide personal details on the user.

USER COMMUNICATIONS

LAW AND JURISDICTION

These general conditions are governed by Spanish legislation, the Spanish Courts and Tribunals being competent to decide on any matters which arise from their interpretation, application and fulfillment. The user, by virtue of their acceptance of the general conditions contained in this legal notice, expressly renounces any jurisdiction which may correspond to them by application of the Code of Civil Procedure regulated by the Spanish law. Interatlantic Fish S.L.U.
